result.execSummary:
The defendant Philip Shane Ullius was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to 16CT22, 17CF600, and Jackson Co case 16CM242.

miscConds.notes: $443 costs to be paid to Clerk of Courts by 6-8-2017; may set up payment plan within 10 days of release from custody.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Philip Shane Ullius

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Per RCSD
Explaining payment plan

Defendant Philip Shane Ullius in court with attorney Jack C. Hoag.  Gerald Anthony Urbik appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  No contest plea, Court finds defendant guilty.  Sentence withheld, Court orders 2 years probation, consecutive to 16CT22, 17CF600, and Jackson Co case 16CM242; with conditions:  $443 costs to be paid to Clerk of Courts by 6-8-2017 (may set up payment plan within 10 days of release from custody); any treatment deemed necessary; no sentence credit if revoked.  Court signs Order to submit DNA.

records.descr: Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis
